<!--
Conventional Commits Pull Request Template

Format: <type>(<optional scope>): <description>

Types:
  feat:     A new feature (minor version bump)
  fix:      A bug fix (patch version bump)
  docs:     Documentation only changes
  style:    Code style changes (formatting, semicolons, etc.)
  refactor: Code refactoring (no feature or bug fix)
  perf:     Performance improvements
  test:     Adding or updating tests
  build:    Build system or external dependency changes
  ci:       CI/CD configuration changes
  chore:    Other changes that don't modify src or test files
  revert:   Reverts a previous commit

Breaking changes: Add ! after type/scope (e.g., feat!: or feat(api)!:)
-->

## Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

## Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does this PR introduce? -->

- [ ] New feature (`feat`)
- [ ] Bug fix (`fix`)
- [ ] Documentation update (`docs`)
- [ ] Style change (`style`)
- [ ] Refactoring (`refactor`)
- [ ] Performance improvement (`perf`)
- [ ] Test update (`test`)
- [ ] Build change (`build`)
- [ ] CI change (`ci`)
- [ ] Chore (`chore`)
- [ ] Revert (`revert`)
- [ ] Breaking change (add `!` to commit type)

## Checklist

- [ ] My PR title follows [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/) format
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix/feature works
- [ ] New and existing tests pass locally
